description: From French anosmatique (“anosmatic”), coined by French anthropologist, anatomist and physician Pierre Paul Broca (1824–1880) in Revue d’Anthropologie (2nd Series), volume II, page 398); analysable as an- +‎ osmatic.

adjectives.description: anosmatic (comparative more anosmatic, superlative most anosmatic)

entries.meaning: (zoology) Lacking olfactory organs, and so having no sense of smell; anosmic. [from 19th c.]
